data.meta_description: Rebecca Budig, an American actress and television host who rose to fame for her portrayal of Michelle Bauer on the CBS soap opera Guiding Light from 1995
data.text:
Rebecca Budig, an American actress and television host who rose to fame for her portrayal of Michelle Bauer on the CBS soap opera Guiding Light from 1995 to 1998, has won six Daytime Emmy Awards.

Additionally, her performance as Greenlee Smythe in Rebecca Budig’s serial opera All My Children, which she reprized from 2008 to 2011, propelled her to international renown. Additionally, she was cast as Hayden Barnes on General Hospital in 2015.

What is Rebecca Budig’s net worth? Salary, Earnings

Rebecca has accumulated a substantial net worth since she began her professional career in 1993. Meanwhile, her precise financial worth remains undisclosed; However, certain sources place it between $3 million and the like. She has established her career as an actress and television presenter.

Budig’s annual salary on the CBS opera serial Guiding Light was reportedly $57,000. Additionally, Rachel Miner, who has a net worth of $3 million, is a Guiding Light star.

In addition to All My Children, Hope & Faith, CSI: Crime Scene Investigation, Blue Bloods and General Hospital, he has appeared on several other television shows.

Instead, his inaugural film appearance occurred in the critically acclaimed Batman Forever, directed by Joel Schumacher and released on June 16, 1995.

Additionally, with a budget of $100 million, the film grossed $336 million internationally, making it the sixth highest-grossing film of the year.

In addition to acting, Rebecca has hosted several television shows, including Better, The Sports Illustrated for Kids Show, and Sunday Night Heat.

In 2010, he won Skating with the Stars for the first and only time. The season premiered on November 22, 2010 and concluded on December 21, 2010.

Where was Rebecca Budig born? Ethnicity, Nationality, Family Education

Rebecca Jo Budig was born in Cincinnati, Ohio, United States, on June 26, 1973. She is the youngest of eight children of merchant George Budig and homemaker Mary Jo. Five older sisters and two brothers make up her sibling ratio.

She earned her degree in Creative and Performing Arts from Cincinnati Public Schools (SCPA). She eventually enrolled in zoology at Miami University in Ohio.

Is Rebecca Budig married? Relationship

After a year of dating, Rebecca Jo, 47, married her fiancé, Michael Benson, for the third time. Budig’s beloved wife, Benson, serves as president and chief marketing officer of CBS.

After a two-year courtship period, the couple exchanged wedding vows in a solemn ceremony in 2012. Before exchanging vows on Christmas Day, December 25, 2010, the couple got engaged.

Benson proposed to Rebecca in 1935 with an antique ruby ​​and diamond ring from Platt Boutique Jewelry. Two years after their wedding, on May 1, 2014, the couple announced that she was expecting her first child for five months.

Budig and her spouse, Michael, embraced the role of parents for the first time with the birth of their daughter Charlotte Jo Benson on September 8, 2014.

“Welcome to the world, Charlotte Jo Benson,” ecstatic father Benson wrote alongside an Instagram photo of his actress wife and newborn daughter.

The General Hospital actress was married twice before Michael. She married Dr. Daniel Geller for the first time in 2000. However, they ended their relationship after a few months.

Bob Guiney, a 49-year-old Bachelor star, later married herself. The union took place in July 2003 at her residence in Long Lake, Michigan, after meeting on Rebecca Budig Family’s The Bachelor. The couple declared their separation on January 13, 2010, after seven years together.

In April 2010, Rebecca began divorce proceedings; The divorce was formalized on July 23, 2010. It should be noted that no spousal support or any type of financial support was requested. After the final season of The Bachelor aired, Bob and Estella Gardinier ended their relationship.
